definition: to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
wooden bench or stool/CL:張|张[zhang1],條|条[tiao2]
to hold an inconsequential job/to receive a cold reception/to be kept waiting for an assignment or audience/to be out in the cold/to be sidelined/to warm the bench/to cool one's heels

tiger bench (torture method in which the victim sits with legs extended horizontally along a bench, upper legs held down with straps while bricks are inserted under the feet, forcing the knee joint to bend in reverse)

sentences.english: If your children can't reach the sink on their own, keep a stepstool handy.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的孩子自己夠不着洗手盆，就進放一張踏步凳。

sentences.english: Portable metal or aluminium ladders should be equipped with non-skid feet.
sentences.chinese: 金屬或鋁製的輕便梯子應當裝防滑凳。

sentences.english: It's like kicking the legs out from under a stool.
sentences.chinese: 這就像踢掉凳子下面的凳腿。

sentences.english: The main room is empty, save for a square wooden dining table with four narrow benches.
sentences.chinese: 客廳是空的，僅有一張喫飯用的方木桌和四張窄凳。

sentences.english: Its horned armrests and legs were covered with goat's fur.
sentences.chinese: 這張椅子的扶手和凳腳長角，並披着羊皮。

sentences.english: The step stools we just finished a few days ago?
sentences.chinese: 這張臺階凳我們幾天前才做好的？

sentences.english: Make a collapsible stool out of plywood that can be stored just about anywhere.
sentences.chinese: 用夾板製作個可以隨處存放的可疊式凳吧。

sentences.english: “Use the piano stool, ” my father said.

definition: wooden bench or stool/CL:張|张[zhang1],條|条[tiao2]
old-fashioned square table to seat eight people
